item.title: World of Warcraft Paladin and Priest Players Should Check Out the Trading Post Rewards for January 2026
item.description:
On December 22, World of Warcraft revealed the rewards that players can earn throughout January on the Trading Post, including several cosmetic rewards adorned in red and gold patterns that may appeal to Paladin and Priest players in particular. The upcoming World of Warcraft Trading Post offers were posted ahead of Christmas, giving players some additional time to plan out what rewards to claim throughout January.

As one of the features introduced during the Dragonflight expansion, the Trading Post gives active World of Warcraft players a way to earn some exclusive cosmetic rewards just from playing the game in different ways. The rewards rotate on a monthly basis, though some have returned in Trading Post offers posted months afterward. WoW subscribers can earn Trader's Tenders by filling out the Traveler's Log, which can be done by completing quests, defeating dungeon and raid bosses, and participating in seasonal events. Throughout December 2025, World of Warcraft 's Trading Post rewards were themed around the Feast of Winter Veil, which is Azeroth's take on Christmas. However, players looking to claim a reward from December's Trading Post will have just a few more days at the time of this writing to get what they want before the month ends.

World of Warcraft Trading Post Rewards (January 2026)

Item Name

Item Type

Cost (Trader's Tender)

Ensemble: Vengeful Regalia of the Crusader

Golden Clockwork Power Hammer

Although the 2025 Feast of Winter Veil is still ongoing across World of Warcraft , Blizzard gave fans an early look at what to expect in the first Trading Post window of 2026. Once the new year arrives, players will have some new cosmetics to add to their growing collections. The main bonus reward for earning 1,000 Traveler's Log points from January 1 to 31 is the Vengeful Regalia of the Crusader ensemble set. This red and gold full suit of armor may appeal to Paladin and Priest players due to the set's Light-based aesthetics. Most of the upcoming Trading Post offers follow suit, as various weapon appearances that will be available in January also carry a red and gold color palette. These rewards include the Crusader's Ruby Mace, the Thalassian Recruit's Bow, and the Crest of Unending Woe.

The most expensive item of WoW 's January 2026 Trading Post reward slate is the Brilliant Sunburst Peafowl, a flying mount with blazing plumage that costs 750 Trader's Tenders. Following that is the Golden Clockwork Attire ensemble set at 650 Tenders, and the Savage Crimson Battle Turtle ground mount at 500 Tenders. Since World of Warcraft players can only earn a limited amount of Trader's Tenders per month, activities like Legion Remix may be worthwhile ventures for players to consider as a way to quickly get the currency needed for these limited-time cosmetic rewards.

January 2026 Will Be A Busy Time In Azeroth

The red and gold color scheme of the January 2026 Trading Post rewards is similar to the primary colors of Silvermoon City, the main player hub of WoW 's upcoming Midnight expansion. As the second chapter of the Worldsoul Saga story arc, World of Warcraft: Midnight will focus on the clash between the Light and the Void. The blood elves' home of Silvermoon City, and the font of power known as the Sunwell, will serve as Midnight 's first battlegrounds. Midnight 's pre-expansion patch will launch on January 20, following server maintenance. The update will include various class changes and adjustments for players to adjust to ahead of World of Warcraft: Midnight 's March 2 launch.

Additionally, the ongoing Turbulent Timeways event will give WoW players a way to get Trader's Tenders and quickly level alternate characters to the current level cap of 80. All in all, the first month of 2026 may be one of the best times to jump back into World of Warcraft and prepare for the Midnight expansion's imminent arrival.

World of Warcraft: Midnight

item.title: 5 Underrated FromSoftware Games That Deserve More Attention
item.description:
FromSoftware is known for creating some of the most iconic and influential action RPGs ever made. The studio's reputation largely revolves around Dark Souls , Bloodborne , Sekiro , and Elden Ring - a collection of games known for creating and defining the Soulslike genre. Each game has had a significant influence on the action RPG and action-adventure genres; yet, long before the developer became synonymous with challenging combat and interconnected worlds, it spent years experimenting with unusual mechanics, atmospheric design philosophies, and genre hybrids. Even after the Soulslike boom, plenty of gems still slip through the cracks of attention.

For players who want to dig deeper into the studio's history and discover the lesser-known corners of its catalog, the following games stand out as the most fascinating and underappreciated.

Metal Wolf Chaos XD

FromSoftware's Most Unhinged Experiment in Mech Action

Metal Wolf Chaos XD
Third-Person Shooter
Systems
Released
August 6, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
From Software
Publisher(s)
Devolver Digital
Genre(s)
Third-Person Shooter
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Metal Wolf Chaos is worth playing for its sheer absurdity alone. To take back the USA from a rebellious vice president, the President of the United States climbs into a heavily armed combat mech. The entire experience feels like an action movie parody wrapped in mecha armor.

The humor isn't all the game has to offer, though, as the gameplay is great fun thanks to the responsive mech mechanics, varied missions, and satisfying destruction physics for the time. The game never takes itself seriously, which gives it a charm unmatched by other titles in the studios catalog.

Metal Wolf Chaos ' obscurity is largely due to having been a Japanese-exclusive on the original Xbox at release. However, a remastered version of the game, Metal Wolf Chaos XD , was released worldwide in 2019 on PC, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One.

Otogi 2: Immortal Warriors

A Forgotten High Point of FromSoftwares Pure Action Era

Otogi 2: Immortal Warriors
Action
Hack and Slash
Systems
Released
December 25, 2003
ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
FromSoftware

Publisher(s)
FromSoftware, Sega
Genre(s)
Action, Hack and Slash
Platform(s)
Xbox (Original), Xbox Series X, Xbox One
How Long To Beat
10 Hours
Powered by

Otogi 2 offers one of FromSoftware's purest action experiences. Released for the original Xbox, the game delivers fast-paced combat, fluid movement, and a mythic aesthetic inspired by Japanese folklore. Players control supernaturally enhanced warriors who cut through demons, spirits, and legendary beasts. The combat is weighty yet graceful, making each encounter feel like a choreographed battle.

Despite its quality, Otogi 2 never achieved mainstream recognition. The original Xbox had a limited audience in Japan, and the game was overshadowed by bigger franchises in the West.

Echo Night: Beyond

An Atmospheric Ghost Story Without Combat

Echo Night: Beyond
Survival Horror
Systems
Released
January 22, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
FromSoftware
Genre(s)
Survival Horror
Platform(s)
PlayStation 2
How Long To Beat
10 hours
Powered by

Echo Night: Beyond takes FromSoftware's love of atmospheric storytelling in a completely different direction, most notably by offering an experience with no combat. Instead of focusing on action, it is a slow-paced ghost story set on a lunar space station that prioritizes eerie atmosphere over scares.

While the game was a niche title on release, it has since earned a cult following for its unique tone and thoughtful storytelling. Among FromSoftware's many experiments, this Echo Night: Beyond remains one of the boldest and most memorable. The fact that the game has a Metascore of 60 but a User Score (at the time of writing) of 8.2 exemplifies the game's place as an underappreciated gem.

Armored Core: For Answer

Speed, Scale, and Customization

Armored Core: For Answer
Third-Person Shooter
Systems
Released
March 19, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T
Developer(s)
From Software
Publisher(s)
From Software, Ubisoft
Multiplayer
Local Multiplayer, Online Multiplayer
Genre(s)
Third-Person Shooter
Platform(s)
PlayStation 3, Xbox 360
How Long To Beat
7.5 Hours
Powered by

Even with the resurgence of the Armored Core franchise thanks to the acclaimed Armored Core 6: Fires of Rubicon , many players still overlooked the brilliance of the earlier games in the series.

Armored Core: For Answer is a particular high point in the long-running franchise. The game lets players fine-tune every aspect of their mech, from its mobility to its weapon loadouts, and throws players into missions that offer great variety and engaging battles that require equal measures of sharp shooting and tactical planning. Armored Core: For Answer was the thirteenth entry in the mecha franchise, and a direct sequel to Armored Core 4 .

King's Field: The Ancient City (King's Field 4)

The Highlight of the Underrated King's Field Series

King's Field: The Ancient City
RPG
Dungeon-Crawler
Systems
Released
March 25, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
FromSoftware
Genre(s)
RPG, Dungeon-Crawler
Platform(s)
PS2
How Long To Beat
23 Hours
Powered by

Among FromSoftware's pre-Souls output, King's Field: The Ancient City is often cited as the studios strongest early RPG. And yet, the game is so often overlooked today due to how the Souls games have eclipsed everything that the studio did before them. King's Field: The Ancient City takes players to a decaying kingdom plagued by a cursed idol, and features the cryptic lore, oppressive atmosphere, and rewarding exploration that the studio has become known for.

GR Report

Level up your gaming knowledge with Game Rant, packed with news, reviews, and insights from the gaming world.

GR Report

Level up your gaming knowledge with Game Rant, packed with news, reviews, and insights from the gaming world.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnets Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Coincidentally, King's Field: The Ancient City shares an identical Metascore of 60 with Echo Night: Beyond , but, also akin to the survival horror game, boasts a far higher User Score, which currently stands at an impressive 8.5.

item.title: 5 Things To Do After Wiping in ARC Raiders
item.description:
In ARC Raiders , the voluntary Wipe mechanic (Expedition Project) can be a challenging new beginning for those trying it for the first time. But with the loss of your previous characters, a new adventure begins. In the ideal conditions, players wiping will receive 5 extra Skill points, and a +10% Experience buff that will make leveling up way faster.

But that doesn't necessarily mean everything is going to go smoothly for them. Even veterans will start regretting not having their old skills right away. However, the silver lining is that they will reach their prime faster this time. This list has five quickstart tips that players should be doing first after wiping in ARC Raiders . Follow these tips to make the most out of this new beginning.

1 Level Up Scrappy Fast

A Raider's Best Friend

Scrappy is not just a pet in ARC Raiders , it will be the players' quartermaster and little scavenger helper, bringing out extra Basic Materials and Seeds after every run through the Surface. The more players level up Scrappy, the faster this collection will be, so their top priority is to level up Scrappy to the maximum possible, before turning their attention to the Workbenches.

This will help players to recover basic mats after the wipe way faster, and if they follow up by installing the Refiner and leveling it up, they will resupply their Stashes with advanced materials in no time. Players will need to rebuild everything from scratch, especially the crafting benches, and with Scrappy's help, they'll do that in no time. So, the first thing will be to get a Dog Collar , to train Scrappy to level 2 , then some Lemons (found in Blue Gate) and Apricots (found in Dam Battlegrounds). With Scrappy at level 3, it will be enough to set things on the right course. Just keep snowballing and crafting useful mats with the Basic Mats this Rooster Pal brings.

2 Collect Priority Loot For Workshop Upgrades

It's Time To Rebuild The Crafting Benches

Once players wipe, they will only have a couple of things in their Stash: Some basic weapons, Light Shields, and Augments. The rest is gone, so the logical step is to rebuild everything all over, starting with the Crafting Benches . Placing them and then leveling them up might be more challenging than what players remember, and there's a good reason for this: With the Skill Trees reset, they don't loot as fast, nor move as fast, nor get extra mats either.

So, the ideal thing to do is to get priority materials that players need for upgrading their benches up to level 2 at least. That means: Rusted Tools , Surveyor Vaults, Rusty Gears , Mechanical and Electrical Components (both regular and advanced), tons of ARC Alloy , ARC Motion Cores, Wasp Drives, Hornet Drives , Cooling Fan, Damaged Heat Sink, Fabric, and the list goes on forever. All the materials players need to upgrade their Workshop can be easily obtained in the maps with Dynamic Events like Night Raid, or Cold Snap, since these have Boosted Loot. Just be careful not to be murdered in the process of looting.

3 Use The EXP Boost To Level Up Faster

If You Are Not Doing This, Then What's The Point Of Wiping?

The more time spent on the Topside, the more EXP the players will gain. That is, as long as they are on the move, killing ARC Enemies, looting containers, and so on. With the EXP buff that they receive after the wipe, fresh-spawned Raiders are a menace; they can climb levels at an alarming speed , and this will be the next thing on the priority list for every player after a wipe: To reach level 30 .

Why that particular level? Because in ideal conditions (that is, if they managed to get the 5000000 Credits needed to obtain 5 extra Skill Points), they will be able to max out one of the three Skill lines (Survival, Mobility, Conditioning), and that's only if they are smart enough to prioritize one of the Skill Trees instead of randomly allocating points. Prioritize Survival for more loot, or Mobility for faster runs . Conditioning can be circumstantial at best or provide significant help for players who love PvP, but that's up for the players to decide.

4 Prioritize Survival Tree To Recover High-Level Gear Faster

This Is The Faster Way Back To The Top

In Round Crafting is the best, no matter how many times players are out of supplies in the Topside, they can easily craft some basic necessities if (and only if) they have this Skill activated on their build. Traveling Tinkerer also helps greatly, but the main reason for prioritizing Survival Tree is the extra loot and the faster looting.

Plus, at level 36, which players will reach at level 30 after Wiping with 5 extra skills, they can unlock Security Lockers that contain tons of high-value Loot, and are scattered through the maps in zones that are not usually contested. Players can spend an entire run just opening these Security lockers and forgetting about PvP. They will be able to regain the best gear, blueprints, and materials in no time .

5 Farm Blueprints

Last And Finally, It's Time To Re-Unlock All Recipes

Having all workbenches leveled up is all nice and good, but what about Blueprints ? Having these is another top priority for a freshly-wiped ARC Raiders player. The problem is: Where to get Blueprints fast? There are a few tricks to accomplish this, and one consists of participating in the many Dynamic Events like Cold Snap and Night Raid. Though these are extremely dangerous for a low-level Raider, they can yield a greater amount of blueprints than regular runs.

Subscribe to the newsletter for ARC Raiders wipe mastery

Want deeper ARC Raiders wipe strategies? Subscribe to our newsletter for expanded strategy breakdowns, curated map routes, and practical rebuild guidesplus broader gaming coverage to help you make each wipe count.

Subscribe to the newsletter for ARC Raiders wipe mastery

By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnets Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

On the other hand, there are safe routes players can follow in each map. For example, in Dam Battlegrounds, the Pale Appartments, and Ruby Residence often contain lots of blueprints , and are not so contested in terms of PvP. The Formicai Outpost, Radio Tower (located between the Scrap Yards and the Water Towers) are also a good place to search for Blueprints. In Buried City , the Library is the optimal place to look for new blueprints. And if players are going to Blue Gate, they can find lots of Blueprints in the Launch Towers , though it's a highly contested PvP zone .

item.title: ARC Raiders: How to Get Advanced Electrical Components
item.description:
One of the key crafting resources in ARC Raiders is the Advanced Electrical Component. Players need it for nearly every aspect of progression, from quests and workbench upgrades to the Projects and limited-time events. The question is, how can you farm these Advanced Electrical Components?

This guide highlights the best farming locations for this rare item across ARC Raiders ' current maps. It also includes tips for crafting Advanced Electrical Components in Speranza, so you won't have to rely on looting them.

  • Advanced Electrical Component

    • Rarity : Rare (Blue)
    • Type : Electrical, Refined Material
    • Weight : One
    • Stack : Five
    • Recycle : Electrical Component (1), Wire (1)
    • Description : "Used to craft utility items and shield mods"

Best Farming Locations for Advanced Electrical Components

The top spot for farming Advanced Electrical Components is the Space Travel area in Buried City. As a Technological section, it's packed with gadgets and utility resources, including Advanced Electrical Components. What makes it especially efficient is that it also provides the materials you need to craft them, such as Wires and regular Electrical Components.

Other Good Spots for Getting Advanced Electrical Components

Pilgrim's Peak

The Blue Gate

Communications, Assembly Workshops

Stella Montis

Power Generation Complex

Dam Battlegrounds

Control Tower

Spaceport

How to Craft Advanced Electrical Components

To craft Advanced Electrical Components, you first need to upgrade the Refiner Workshop to level two . This requires three Toasters, five ARC Motion Cores, and eight Fireball Burners. Once the Refiner is upgraded, you can combine three Wires with two Electrical Components to create an Advanced Electrical Component.

You can buy some of the resources needed to craft Advanced Electrical Components from Celeste.

How to Get Advanced Electrical Components by Recycling

Certain gadgets can be recycled to obtain Advanced Electrical Components. Here's a complete list:

  • Spectrometer
  • Frequency Modulation Box
  • Power Rod
  • Rocketeer Driver
  • Telemetry Transceiver
  • High-rarity Augments

What to Do with Advanced Electrical Components

If you're a beginner in ARC Raiders , it's wise to hold onto your Advanced Electrical Components. This resource becomes crucial at higher levels when crafting high-tier gear and weapons. It's also commonly required for projects and events, so having some on hand can help you take full advantage of rotating rewards.

Subscribe to the newsletter for ARC Raiders farming tips and more

Want more actionable ARC Raiders strategies? Subscribe to the newsletter for detailed deep dives into crafting, recycling lists, optimal farming locations, and resource planning - everything you need to maximize Advanced Electrical Components and other key materials.

Subscribe to the newsletter for ARC Raiders farming tips and more

Want more actionable ARC Raiders strategies? Subscribe to the newsletter for detailed deep dives into crafting, recycling lists, optimal farming locations, and resource planning - everything you need to maximize Advanced Electrical Components and other key materials.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnets Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Once you've unlocked the ability to craft Advanced Electrical Components, you don't need to stockpile them. You can always salvage unwanted electronics to obtain Wires and Electrical Components as needed. This also allows you to sell any excess Advanced Electrical Components for profit, although most players know that reselling crafted items isn't the most efficient way to earn money in ARC Raiders .

Tips for Getting More Advanced Electrical Components

Keep these points in mind:

  • Salvage while topside . If you come across electronics you don't need, salvage them to get Wires and Electrical Components. This lets you gather the materials needed to craft Advanced Electrical Components even before upgrading the Refiner.
  • Try Night Raids . For better drop rates, head to the Space Travel area in Buried City during a Night Raid event. This map condition makes the game more challenging but increases the chances of finding rare items like Advanced Electrical Components.
  • Prioritize upgrading the Utility station . Invest in upgrading the Utility Workbench with your Advanced Electrical Components, as this station is essential for crafting high-tier key items, such as the Snap Hook.
10 /10

ARC Raiders

item.title: Best Budget Loadout for PvP & PvE in Arc Raiders
item.description:
ARC Raiders is a PvPvE extraction shooter that relies on players being prepared to encounter both dangerous ARC machines and other hostile players. Coins are the major currency in the game, but losing your gear in multiple raids could really thin your wallet. If you don't want to rely on random gear that comes with a free loadout, here are some cheap PvP and PvE builds that are budget-friendly and let you put up a good fight against the threats that roam Topside.

Best Cheap/Budget PvP Loadout & Build in ARC Raiders

Build Cost

  • ~13,000 coins

Augment

  • Looting MK. 1

Weapons

  • Stitcher
  • Ferro

Quick Use Items

  • 5x Shield Rechargers
  • 5x Herbal Medkits
  • 5x Impact Grenades

If you like engaging in PvP fights in ARC Raiders and need a solid build that's not hard on your coin purse, this one's for you. The build has two weapons, the Ferro and the Stitcher . Ferro will be great for mid to long-range gunfights, while Sticher is amazing in close-range encounters.

The optimal way to play this build is by starting off a fight by shooting them with a ferro, which can instantly break a small shield. Follow it up with a burst of Stitcher close-range, and you'll have a dead raider's backpack ready to loot. The Looting MK.1 Augment is best in slot for a cheap build, considering you'll be looting knocked out raiders.

Avoid going full-auto with the Stitcher when you're far away from the enemy, as you'll miss most of the shots with the increased bloom and recoil.

Two stacks of light ammo and one stack of heavy ammo should be plenty for a quick round of PvP in a raid.

This budget PvP build in ARC Raiders also has full stacks of Shield Rechargers and Herbal Medkits , to keep your HP and Shield topped up before and after a fight. You also have the option to chuck a few grenades at the enemies to break their shields or take them down.

Best Budget/Cheap PvE (Looting) Build & Loadout in ARC Raiders

Build Cost

  • ~13,000 coins

Augment

  • Looting MK. 1

Weapons

  • Rattler
  • Ferro

Quick Use Items

  • 3x Shield Rechargers
  • 3x Herbal Medkits
  • 5x Li'l Smoke Grenades
  • 3x Adrenaline Shots

This next ARC Raiders budget build is for friendly PvE players who don't want to engage in PvP fights and just want to loot and return to Speranza unharmed. The build centers around two weapons, the Ferro and the Rattler .

Now I know the community hasn't been very fond of the Rattler 1 due to its low mag capacity. However, the Cold Snap update buffed it up to 12 rounds instead of 10 , which does make it slightly more manageable against ARCs and other players (if aimed at the head).

This main will focus on taking out minor ARCs like Wasps, Hornets, Fireballs, Pops, Ticks, and even a Shredder. One shot of Ferro can take out flying ARC propellers and even Fireballs inside the buildings, while a few shots from Rattler can easily destroy Pops and Ticks (to conserve Ferro's ammo).

Subscribe to the newsletter for budget ARC Raiders builds

Want more practical ARC Raiders loadouts and looting tips? Subscribe to the newsletter for tested, budget-friendly builds, weapon pairings, and consumable setups to improve your Topside runs.

Subscribe to the newsletter for budget ARC Raiders builds

Want more practical ARC Raiders loadouts and looting tips? Subscribe to the newsletter for tested, budget-friendly builds, weapon pairings, and consumable setups to improve your Topside runs.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnets Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

The quick-use items have three stacks of Shield Rechargers and Herbal Medkits , just in case you take a few hits from an ARC machine. If you encounter an enemy raider Topside, throw a Li'l Smoke Grenade , which will give you an ample opportunity to escape their line of sight.

Since this ARC Raiders budget PvE build is centered around looting, the Augment MK.1 will give you ample backpack space to do so. Since you'll be running between multiple buildings, three stacks of Adrenaline shots will keep your stamina topped up so you can get to that sweet, sweet loot before other raiders.

This build is meant for players who wish to avoid PvP confrontations and solely want to loot. However, there's enough firepower on you that you can hold your ground if you position yourself right.

10 /10

ARC Raiders
